Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in affirming the RPD's decision regarding internal flight alternative (IFA)
Evidence_Assessment: Attack was random; IFAs in Mumbai and New Delhi were viable
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claims dismissed due to existence of viable IFA
Burden_of_Proof: On claimants to prove persecution and lack of viable IFA
Legal_Rule: Claimants must prove they face persecution or risk and lack a viable IFA under IRPA
Procedural_Issue: Applicants failed to challenge RPD's IFA finding before RAD
Outcome_on_Merits: Claims rejected due to viable IFA
Key_Evidence_Considered: Existence of safe areas (Mumbai, New Delhi) as IFA
Applicant_Challenge: RAD mischaracterized facts, but did not challenge IFA findings
Remedy_Requested: Overturn RAD decision, grant refugee protection
Remedy_Sought: Allowance of refugee claim, protection status
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to Convention refugee and person in need of protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on refugee protection and IFA
Applicable_Process: Refugee determination process: RPD → RAD → Federal Court judicial review
Governing_Rule: Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) doctrine under IRPA
